Package scenario

Class Scenario

java.lang.Object
scenario.Scenario
public class Scenario extends Object
Scenario is a class that offers a way to encapsulate a list of commands that the system can execute (all together or in different scheduled times) in any given moment. It also allows the user to set a monitoring state for each observable device.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns:
      the name of the Scenario.

    • setDeviceMonitoring

      public void setDeviceMonitoring(ObservableDevice device, boolean enable)
      Specify a certain monitoring-state for a given device in the current instance of Scenario
      Parameters:
      device - the device whose the user wants to choose the monitoring state
      enable - the specified monitoring state

    • changeName

      public void changeName(String newName)
      Parameters:
      newName - the name the user wants to set for the current instance of Scenario

    • addCommand

      public void addCommand(String devName, long delaySecs, long repeatSecs, Command cmd)
      Add a command to the list of scheduled commands for this scenario.
      Parameters:
      devName - is the name of the device
      delaySecs - if it's equal to 0, the command runs instantly. Otherwise, it will be executed after the specified amount of seconds
      repeatSecs - if it's equal to 0, the command runs once. Otherwise, it will be executed at every specified amount of time.
      cmd - is the command that has to be executed

    • removeCommand

      public void removeCommand(int index)
      Removes a command from the list of scheduled commands of this scenario.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the command to delete.

    • removeCommandByDevice

      public int removeCommandByDevice(String devName)

    • commandListToString

      public String commandListToString()
      Returns:
      a String containing a list of every command scheduled for the scenario.

    • apply

      public void apply(SmartHomeController controller)
      Applies the scenario to a given controller.
      Parameters:
      controller - controller who has to execute the scenario.
